page.title: 02Carnoustie's Coastline
page.content: Carnoustie's coast has two main parts, a sandy shore and a rocky shore.The beach faces south and on a clear day Fife can be seen.Buoys used by the{Carnoustie Sailing Club}are also visible. The western section of the sandy shore is not accessible because of range practice by the army camp at {Barry Buddon.}Sailing passed the "B" mark is forbidden for the same reasons. Plant and animal life is abundant.Several species of deep and shallow water seaweed can be found in the rock-pools.They perfectly hide crabs,blennies,star-fish and small flat-fish.Bivalves include razors, cockles, mussels and wedge-shells. Common molluscs are limpets and whelks. The area is ideal for tourists.
